detaileddescription.para:
Create a drop down list objects
par
pointer to an object, it will be the parent of the new drop down list
copy
pointer to a drop down list object, if not NULL then the new object will be copied from it
pointer to the created drop down list

Set text of the ddlist (Displayed on the button if show_selected = false)
ddlist
pointer to a drop down list object
txt
the text as a string (Only it's pointer is saved)

Clear any options in a drop down list. Static or dynamic.
ddlist
pointer to drop down list object

Set the options in a drop down list from a string
ddlist
pointer to drop down list object
options
a string with ' ' separated options. E.g. "One\nTwo\nThree" The options string can be destroyed after calling this function

Set the options in a drop down list from a string
ddlist
pointer to drop down list object
options
a static string with ' ' separated options. E.g. "One\nTwo\nThree"

Add an options to a drop down list from a string. Only works for dynamic options.
ddlist
pointer to drop down list object
option
a string without ' '. E.g. "Four"
pos
the insert position, indexed from 0, LV_DROPDOWN_POS_LAST = end of string

Set the selected option
ddlist
pointer to drop down list object
sel_opt
id of the selected option (0 ... number of option - 1);

Set the direction of the a drop down list
ddlist
pointer to a drop down list object
dir
LV_DROPDOWN_DIR_LEF/RIGHT/TOP/BOTTOM

Set the maximal height for the drop down list
ddlist
pointer to a drop down list
h
the maximal height

Set an arrow or other symbol to display when the drop-down list is closed.
ddlist
pointer to drop down list object
symbol
a text like LV_SYMBOL_DOWN or NULL to not draw icon

Set whether the ddlist highlight the last selected option and display its text or not
ddlist
pointer to a drop down list object
show
true/false

Get text of the ddlist (Displayed on the button if show_selected = false)
ddlist
pointer to a drop down list object
the text string

Get the options of a drop down list
ddlist
pointer to drop down list object
the options separated by ' '-s (E.g. "Option1\nOption2\nOption3")

Get the selected option
ddlist
pointer to drop down list object
id of the selected option (0 ... number of option - 1);

Get the total number of options
ddlist
pointer to drop down list object
the total number of options in the list

Get the current selected option as a string
ddlist
pointer to ddlist object
buf
pointer to an array to store the string
buf_size
size of buf in bytes. 0: to ignore it.

Get the fix height value.
ddlist
pointer to a drop down list object
the height if the ddlist is opened (0: auto size)

Get the symbol to draw when the drop-down list is closed
ddlist
pointer to drop down list object
the symbol or NULL if not enabled

Get the symbol to draw when the drop-down list is closed
ddlist
pointer to drop down list object
the symbol or NULL if not enabled

Get whether the ddlist highlight the last selected option and display its text or not
ddlist
pointer to a drop down list object
true/false

Open the drop down list with or without animation
ddlist
pointer to drop down list object

Close (Collapse) the drop down list
ddlist
pointer to drop down list object
anim_en
LV_ANIM_ON: use animation; LV_ANOM_OFF: not use animations
